Docs.summary: Defines the contract a control implements to act as a configuration control for a transformer in a Web Parts connection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A configuration control can be displayed when a transformer requires a user to configure it. The configuration control provides a user interface (UI) that allows the user to select which values will be transformed. It is rendered in a connections zone. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer.CreateConfigurationControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns a configuration control.
You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer.CreateConfigurationControl%2A> method when your transformer requires a customized UI. The configuration control must implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ITransformerConfigurationControl> interface, which includes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ITransformerConfigurationControl.Cancelled> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ITransformerConfigurationControl.Succeeded> events. These events occur when a transformer control was either not configured or configured successfully, respectively.

Docs.summary: Occurs when transformer configuration is not completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Web Parts control that implements <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ITransformerConfigurationControl> raises this event when a transformer configuration is not completed, either because the user canceled the configuration or because the configuration could not be performed.

Docs.summary: Occurs when transformer configuration is successfully completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Web Parts control that implements <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ITransformerConfigurationControl> raises this event when a transformer configuration is successfully completed.
